thread.title: Newborn baby survives fiery Christmas Eve crash that killed 2 adults in car, police say
thread.title_full: Newborn baby survives fiery Christmas Eve crash that killed 2 adults in car, police say

author: @WRDW_WAGT
title: Newborn baby survives fiery Christmas Eve crash that killed 2 adults in car, police say
text:
Newborn baby survives fiery Christmas Eve crash that killed 2 adults in car, police say
HALIFAX COUNTY, Va. ([WDBJ](https://www.wdbj7.com/2024/12/25/two-killed-fiery-christmas-eve-crash/)/Gray News) – A fiery crash in Virginia on Christmas Eve left two adults dead, and a newborn baby was flown to a hospital.
The crash happened Tuesday afternoon on Chatham Road in Halifax County.
Virginia State Police said the driver of a Jeep crossed the center line into oncoming traffic, and the driver of a Ford Explorer traveling in the opposite direction attempted to swerve out of the way.
The two vehicles collided head-on, police said.
A good Samaritan and first responders pulled three people – including two adults and a 1-month-old baby – from the Jeep, which had caught fire.
Officials said the Jeep’s driver, identified as 22-year-old Danyelle Hankins, and passenger 30-year-old DaShawn White both died at the scene.
The 1-month-old infant was flown to the hospital, along with the driver of the Ford Explorer. Their current conditions are unknown.
[A GoFundMe page](https://www.gofundme.com/f/hankins-tragic-loss-and-support) has been set up to help Hankins’ family with funeral expenses.
